Information for consumers and third parties

Messages, symbols and pictorials are intended to provide safety information to consumers, service technicians, and others who may be exposed to a battery's potentially hazardous conditions. Labels should consider all local, state and federal requirements . The following information need to be available:

  • The safety information of the battery shall be indicated with marking and labeling. The information shall contain principal hazards, special handling instructions and first aid instructions. Battery that contains poisonous materials shall be labeled clearly to identify this hazards using words like ‘Danger,Poison’
  • Identification of the polarity of each of the battery module terminals is required
  • Information on the recycling of the battery pack systems
  • Environmental guidelines for the storage the pack as a complete assembly or as components of service.
  • Requirements for shipping
  • Instruction for installation and integration into the end use vehicle
  • Instruction for proper use including charging, discharging, replacement and disposal
  • Electric energy storage assemblies intended for removal and charging outside of the vehicle shall be provided with instructions for the safe handling including removal and insertion of assembly into the vehicle and during charging and instructions for storage of fully charged assemblies.
